description: The schema for the error message response from the validation process

consignmentId.description: The unique identifier of the consignment. Tha validation is of a metadata file that is related to this consignment

fileError.description: The type of error that completed validation of the file. Schema validation is the most common and indicates data validation errors

date.description: The date the validation was completed

validationErrors.description: The list of validation errors. The metadata file for TDR is a CSV file so there can be multiple ValidationErrors (each ValidationErrors is for one row in the CSV file)

assetId.description: The unique identifier of the asset (in TDR will probably be the file path) to allow matching back to the original data. The value will be the metadata file name if the error if for the file rather than its data

errors.description: The list of errors for this asset's metadata. The data is a list of key value pairs with property name and value. There could zero/one or many errors associated with each value

validationProcess.description: The process that failed validation (could be a specific schema)

property.description: The property (key) that failed validation. This will be the key provided by the consumer

errorKey.description: The error key to indicate why it failed validation (for schema validation this is from the JsonSchema validator)

message.description: The user friendly message for the error. In TDR derived from the validation-message.properties file with key derived from {validationProcess}.{property}.{errorKey}

data.description: The data that failed validation. This is a list of key value pairs with property name and value
